comments: The compositions of n  in which each natural number is colored by one of  p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n.  For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of  46-colored compositions of n such that  no adjacent parts have  the same color. - Milan Janjic, Nov 17 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..100
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (46).
formula: G.f.: 1/(1-46*x). [From _Philippe Del√©ham_, Nov 24 2008]a(n)=46^n; a(n)=46*a(n-1) a(0)=1 [From Vincenzo Librandi, Nov 21 2010]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
